ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: your companion is not misguided or misled;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: That your companion is not confused, nor has he gone astray,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: your companion has neither strayed nor is he deluded;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: your companion is not in error nor has he gone astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Your companion did not err, nor did he go astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Your companion has neither gone astray nor has he erred.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Your companion does not err, nor does he go astray;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: your comrade is not astray, neither errs,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Your comrade erreth not, nor is deceived;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: your companion has neither strayed nor is he misguided,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Your companion hath not gone astray, nor hath he erred.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: your companion has neither gone astray, nor amiss.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Your Companion is neither astray nor being misled.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Your companion (Muhammad SAW) has neither gone astray nor has erred.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: your companion is neither astray, neither errs,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Your friend has not gone astray, nor has he erred.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Your companion [Muhammad] has not strayed, nor has he erred,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:2] your companion, Muhammad (s), may God bless him and grant him peace, has neither gone astray, from the path of guidance, nor has he erred, nor has he engaged in error (al-ghayy is ignorance that results from a false belief);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Your comrade erreth not) this is the reason why Allah made the above oath: your Prophet Muhammad (pbuh) did not lie about what he said to you, (nor is deceived) he is not wrong nor did he err in what he said;
